title: (x) typeface in Sony ads - FF Blur (stretched) {Jos
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011235349im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38523.jpg)   
   
It's from SONY ads - any help?   
TIA   
Philip
author: anonymous

comments.content: I think if that is blur it was reworked. The crossbar of Blur Light's lowercase "e" does not connect as it does in the sample posted above.

Yeah, and the \_t\_ is a little bit thicker.   
   
Perhaps Neville Brody reworked it for Sony (?)

Well the "n" is the genuine article, so let's stick to   
customized FF Blur until someone can provide irrefutable   
proof it's something else. _(I'm sounding like the American   
juridical system here... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011235349im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif))_

Oh yes! Actually FF Blur is not exactly the same, my sample is something - uhm - taller and wider (argh, sorry for my poor english) Probably Sony reworked it... They can't use a commercial font, of course, they must have their own font... But it's very very similar!   
Thank you font Gurus, thank you very much!
